node.quote: Send it!
node.derbyhistory: Started with Rat City’s Pinkies program in September 2017 then moved up through Fundies and CRL to eventually being drafted to Danger in October 2018.
node.previoussports: So many! I played water polo and swam in college but in my high school years I did wrestling, diving, gymnastics, tennis, lacrosse, and soccer. I also love to ski and snowboard!
node.injuries: Broke my ankle in 2019. Now I'm bionic!
node.favoritemovie: I'm More of a TV kinda gal
node.awards: Rookie of the Year for Season 15!
node.other: Maybe ask how we got into derby or favorite derby memory?

node.quote: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind, don't matter, and those who matter, don't mind.
node.derbyhistory: I started playing in 2013 at Fort Irwin military base in the middle of the Mojave desert, California (Heavy ArmHer Roller Derby-HARD). I then played for 3 years in Kaiserslautern, Germany for Roller Girls of the Apocalypse (RGA), now Kaiserslautern Roller Derby (KRD). We played all over Europe in places like Prague, Amsterdam, Portugal, and Milan. I moved to Seattle in late 2018 and was drafted to the Rat City Throttle Rockets in Feb 2019. I have loved every minute of my time with Rat City.
node.injuries: Concussion(s), whiplash, broken pinky, torn ankle ligaments, torn labrum and other shoulder issues.
node.profession: Army Nurse/Grad student studying to be a Certified Nurse Midwife
node.awards: Queen of the sin bin for my old league (RGA in Germany) 2016/2017
node.getpumpedupsong: Whatever gets us all singing and dancing as a team
node.other: Derby crushes - Scald and Trample of course . Misty and Rome from Rat City (shh) ;)

node.quote: "Scully, this is a classic case of demon fetal harvest." - Fox Mulder
node.derbyhistory: I've played roller derby since 2017. I began my career playing fast derby with a USARS league in Arizona. After a brief stint with a WFTDA league in Phoenix, I moved to Seattle and joined Rat City Roller Derby. After a couple of months off skates because of a broken wrist I got while skating in my first Rat scrimmage, I was drafted to the Throttle Rockets in February 2019.
node.injuries: Broken wrist in 2018 and broken ankle/fibula in 2019
node.awards: A few MVP Jammers here and there, but my most treasured one is the MVP Jammer is the one I got in a 2019 game against DLF. It was the first game in which I jammed for the Throttle Rockets, so it was an awesome experience.
node.other: Shades of pink and glitter run in my veins!

node.derbyhistory: I started playing derby in 2011 in Dallas. I skated for Assassination City Roller Derby and the Dallas Derby Devils before moving to Seattle in 2019.
node.injuries: I broke my ankle during practice a few years ago.

node.quote: Having fun is the key to what makes us great!
node.derbyhistory: 10 years in juniors, 1 Year in Junior World Cup, a half a season with Rain of Terror and this is my second year with DLF!
node.previoussports: Dirt biking, Skiing, Snowboarding, and Hiking
node.injuries: A ridiculously persistent dead leg! I have never broken a bone!
node.profession: I am a student and work at Roller Derby Skate Shop! They are the best!!
node.awards: Selma Soul Award and World Cup Gold medal
node.getpumpedupsong: That’s my Girl by Fifth Harmony

node.quote: "It pleased her, the silliness of it all." -Tanith Lee
node.derbyhistory: I learned to skate with Sonoma County Roller Derby and skated a few games on their charter before moving to Seattle in Nov 2018. I joined Rat City in Jan 2019 and was drafted to DLF Feb 2019 where I exist with my people.
node.injuries: Some sprains but nothing too serious.
node.favoritemovie: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
node.awards: Various misc. Best Jammer awards, and a couple coveted Best Blockers. Nothing significant.
node.other: What pets do I have! Answer: 2 tuxedo cats (Pixel and TeraByte), an adopted Yorkie (Beelzebub, who came with my partner), and the Greatest Floof: Waffle the Pomeranian

node.derbyhistory: Jet City Roller Derby, Rat City Roller Derby, Coached Jr. Roller Derby

node.quote: “I can be friends with you and still hit you really hard”

node.quote: Don’t stop me now, I’m having such a good time

node.previoussports: High school soccer, and nothing that prepared me for roller derby
node.injuries: Tib & fib fracture after an ill fated stunt at the skate park
node.awards: There’s a beautiful rat on a plaque hung above my fireplace for RoT Star from my first season with Rain of Terror and the All Star Program, and a small but proud collection of MVBs.
node.getpumpedupsong: Eye of the Tiger, classic catchy guitar riff and my injury recovery mantra (don’t lose your grip on your dreams of the past, you must fight just to keep them alive)

node.team: All Stars Program, Derby Liberation Front

node.injuries: Thankfully nothing serious! Just some sprained ankles and bruises

node.quote: Dream big, fight hard!

node.previoussports: Soccer and rugby, but derby is my one true love.
node.injuries: Dislocated shoulder, right ankle sprain.
node.favoritemovie: Never seen one. Who has time for that?

node.other: Nope, thanks for putting this together!

node.quote: Go big or go home!
node.derbyhistory: I started with TTRB in 2013 and then Dockyard 2015 and currently CRL
node.injuries: Broken ankle

node.quote: "We'll take this leap, and we'll see. We'll jump, and we'll see. That's life." Patricia (Meg Ryan) to Joe (Tom Hanks) in "Joe Versus the Volcano"
node.derbyhistory:
McLean County Missfits (Bloomington, IL): November 2010 - November 2013; Bellingham Roller Betties (Bellingham, WA): December 2013 - June 2017; Rat City Roller Derby: June 2017 - Present.
The wonderful thing about skating with many leagues is that I have so many life long friends, and there is always room in my heart for more.
node.position: Blocker! (I may reluctantly, pushily, and shoutily jam very occasionally)
node.previoussports: Does theater count? I also dabbled in soccer, volleyball, fastpitch softball (they had to special order my batting helmet because my head was/is very large), swimming, and track and field (throwing the shotput - I don't run.). I was not what you would call good at any of these sports. Roller Derby is the first sport that I wanted to work hard to be good at.
node.injuries: Sprained MCL and partially torn PCL in March, 2011 (wear thick knee pads everyone!), broken tibia (two places at the tip) in January 2014, and multiple sprained ankles (usually from gameplay, but one was from dancing too hard at the afterparty)
node.profession: Elementary School Teacher (before that I was a lawyer)
node.awards: I've won some MVPs. It was awesome, but as I have told the juniors I coach, MVPs aren't the only way to know that you are doing well and being effective! I also was the winner of Best Boutfit in 2012!
node.getpumpedupsong: "Mama Said Knock You Out" - LL Cool J; "Invincible" - Pat Benetar; and "The Warrior" - Scandal ft. Patty Smyth. Fine, fine - on bout day I also prance around my apartment in my boutfit to "My Strongest Suit" from "Aida" (the musical, not the opera).

node.quote: “I will prepare and some day my chance will come.” —Abraham Lincoln
node.derbyhistory: I started with the Lansing Derby Vixens (Lansing, MI) in 2011, and played with them for 5 years before moving to Seattle with my partner. I have been with RCRD for 3 seasons on Grave Danger and ASP. I’ve been lucky enough to play in 11 states, plus the UK and Canada.
node.previoussports: I was more of an artsy kid growing up, so starting derby at 21 years old was the first time I played a competitive sport!
node.injuries: Separated shoulder, and PCL and ACL injuries
node.profession: Grad student at the University of Washington
node.getpumpedupsong: “I Want to Break Free” by Queen, “Deceptacon” by Le Tigre, “Ready to Die” by Andrew WK

node.team: All Stars Program, Derby Liberation Front

node.derbyhistory: Started in Fargo, ND with FMDG in 2012, then moved to Tacoma, WA and skated with Dockyard, JBLM, OPP, Queer Squad Washington, Grunge City, and Skate Club. Moved to Vancouver, WA and skated with Storm City, then moved back up to Seattle and drafted to the Sockit Wenches on Rat!
node.previoussports: I dabble in rugby, but I'm really bad at it. Derby was my first ever sport.
node.injuries: 3 knee injuries (derby related) and broken right foot twice (not derby related)
node.profession: Procurement Analyst. But that's boring. I have over a a decade of cake decorating under my belt and that's where my passion lies
node.favoritemovie: 1. Harold and Maude 2. Hedwig and the Angry Inch 3. Stranger than Fiction
node.awards: I've won MVP Jammer and Blocker, Best Line Banter, and Life of the Afterparty
node.other: I have too many hobbies and interests. I bake, sing karaoke, play dungeons and dragons, I used to be an opera singer, wedding cake decorator, and a clown. I kinda just decide I'm going to do something and jump in the deep end.

node.quote: "I just took a DNA test, turns out I'm 100% that Wench."
node.derbyhistory: 2013: I learned how to skate in Potential Fresh Meat (PFM), joined Rat Lab with Rat City, and drafted to the Sockit Wenches a month later at the end of the 2013 season. 2014: I skated half a season as a jammer with the Wenches before having a hip injury requiring surgery and retired. 2015-2017: No skating due to popping out 2 tiny humans :) 2018: Came out of retirement and re-drafted to the Sockit Wenches as a jammer! BLEED BLUE AND ORANGE! 2019: Skated as a blocker for the Rat City All Star Program 2020: Ready for what Season 16 has to offer.
node.previoussports: Figure skating, Golf, and Track & Field
node.injuries: Labral tear in left hip
node.profession: Product Marketing Manager for Microsoft Azure
node.awards: 2013 Portland 4x4 MVP Jammer - Sockit Wenches vs. Guns N' Rollers 2019 MVP Blocker - Rat City vs. Angel City

node.other:
The only changes are name and photo.
My derby name should just be Featherstone, not L. Featherstone. Also it still shows a Grave Danger logo :( I don't know if this round of edits includes photos (I'll live) but I'd love to use my headshot from this season (David Oh - RCRD HeadshotSZN16-EXTRA-60).
I selected "was" on ASP for previous seasons given the directions but I am not for 2020.

node.quote: “She is free in her wildness, she is a wanderess, a drop of free water. She knows nothing of borders and cares nothing for rules or customs. 'Time' for her isn’t something to fight against. Her life flows clean, with passion, like fresh water.”

node.injuries: Meniscus Tear, had surgery to remove the torn piece
